hero.headline: How to Start Live Streaming on YouTube
hero.subheadline: Go live on YouTube. Setup, equipment, and strategies for successful streams.

sections.content: Live streaming builds deeper connections with your audience. YouTube Live offers powerful featuresâ€”Super Chats, live chat, and automatic VOD saving. Here's how to set up and run successful live streams on YouTube.

sections.title: Basic Live Stream Setup
content: Enable live streaming in YouTube Studio

content.title: OBS Studio
content.description: Free, powerful, customizable. Industry standard for streaming.

content.title: StreamYard
content.description: Browser-based, easy guests. Great for interviews and podcasts.

content.title: YouTube Webcam
content.description: No software needed. Basic but works for simple streams.

content.title: Good Webcam
content.description: Logitech C920 or better. Consider mirrorless for quality jump.

content.title: Quality Microphone
content.description: Audio quality crucial for streams. USB mic minimum.

content.title: Lighting
content.description: Face well-lit. Ring light or key light makes huge difference.

faq.question: Why wait 24 hours to stream?
faq.answer: YouTube verification requirement for new channels. Prevents spam and abuse. Enable it early so you're ready when needed.

faq.question: What internet speed do I need?
faq.answer: Minimum 10 Mbps upload for 1080p. 20+ Mbps recommended for stability. Wired connection always better than WiFi for streaming.

faq.question: OBS vs StreamYard?
faq.answer: OBS more powerful, free, steeper learning curve. StreamYard easier, great for guests, browser-based. Both work well with YouTube.

faq.question: How to get viewers on live streams?
faq.answer: Consistency is key. Stream same time weekly. Promote beforehand. Engage chat actively. YouTube suggests streams to subscribers.
